intro: Pieridia ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaf butterflyweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that attract various pollinators. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are oval-shaped and arranged alternately along the stems, contributing to its distinctive appearance. The flowers bloom in clusters, adding a vibrant touch to its natural habitat.
